pros: Great place to work with good people
cons: Do not have any cons to mention

job_title: New Graduate Family NP in Providence, RI
pros: Good community and support from staff
cons: Too many encounters, little admin time

job_title: Service Desk Supervisor in Providence, RI
pros: the only pro is that you can work from home.
cons: You have members of senior leadership that don't belong in their positions. If you want to be constantly belittled micromanaged and talked down upon then work for the CIO. It is stated that its a 8 to 5 job. No you will be working a lot more than that and not compensated for it. There is no such thing as work life balance at this organization from the IT perspective. The benefits are horrible. Every time i went to the dr i got a bill. Your holidays are figured into your PTO so even though it seems like a lot it really isn't. You don't have any sick time either

job_title: Family Nurse Practitioner in Providence, RI
pros: Sense of community and working together as a team
cons: Computer system takes a long time to navigate

pros: People and Community. Your own Personal RN and MA. Heavy spanish speaking workforce and most of your patients are also spanish speaking. Four day workweek available.
cons: Low pay and your bonus is maxxed out at 30,000k(this includes both quality and productivity).

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Providence, RI
pros: Low staff and it seem as if they were not looking to add more to the team.
cons: Free lunch a few days a week, they had managers always available if you had any questions on the task.

pros: Great mission and values , rewarding, great benefits,

pros: Excellent pay and Benefits. Nice staff, Medical Record Trainer was very nice. He had a great personality and was very encouraging!
cons: Different locations going in different directions. Alignment is needed to enable structure/standardization.  Management gets ideas and try's to make changes but they don't know what's going on.
